intro: Carex tatsiensis, commonly known as Tatsien Lake sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescences. Native to the region around Tatsien Lake in China, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features small, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
